intro: Linzia accommodata, commonly known as the yellow linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. Linzia accommodata is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wet meadows.
